member.name: T:IpawsAlert.Core.Channels.WeaChannelConfig
member.summary:
Configuration for the WEA (Wireless Emergency Alerts / CMAS) channel.
WEA messages are broadcast to all cell phones in the targeted area. The IPAWS-OPEN gateway extracts the CMAMtext / CMAMlongtext parameters from the CAP <info> block to form the over-the-air message.

member.name: P:IpawsAlert.Core.Channels.WeaChannelConfig.ShortText
member.summary: WEA alert classification: Extreme + Immediate → Presidential or Extreme (e.g. Tornado Warning) Severe + Immediate → Severe (e.g. Flash Flood Warning) Public Safety Message → AMBER, Imminent Threat, etc. IPAWS infers this from the CAP Severity/Urgency fields.
Short (90-char legacy) WEA message text. Used for WEA 2.0. Leave null to use the CAP headline. FEMA maps this to the <parameter> CMAMtext.

member.name: P:IpawsAlert.Core.Channels.WeaChannelConfig.LongText
member.summary: Long (360-char) WEA message text for WEA 3.0 capable handsets. FEMA maps this to the <parameter> CMAMlongtext.

member.name: P:IpawsAlert.Core.Channels.WeaChannelConfig.IncludeEmbeddedLink
member.summary: If true, the alert includes embedded phone number / URL in the WEA message. Requires WEA 3.0 support.

member.name: P:IpawsAlert.Core.Channels.WeaChannelConfig.EmbeddedPhone
member.summary: Telephone number to embed in the WEA message (WEA 3.0 only).

member.name: P:IpawsAlert.Core.Channels.WeaChannelConfig.EmbeddedUrl
member.summary: URL to embed in the WEA message (WEA 3.0 only, max 23 chars after shortening).

member.name: T:IpawsAlert.Core.Channels.EasChannelConfig
member.summary:
Configuration for the EAS (Emergency Alert System) channel.
EAS distributes alerts to broadcast stations (TV, radio) via the FEMA EAS Header and audio/visual interrupt. The CAP SAME geocodes are used to target EAS distribution areas.

member.name: P:IpawsAlert.Core.Channels.EasChannelConfig.EventCode
member.summary: EAS event code (3-character NWS/SAME code, e.g. "TOR", "SVR", "EVI"). If null, IPAWS-OPEN maps from the CAP event string. Reference: https://www.nws.noaa.gov/directives/sym/pd01017012curr.pdf

member.name: P:IpawsAlert.Core.Channels.EasChannelConfig.OrgCode
member.summary: Organization code for the EAS header (up to 8 chars, e.g. "WXR", "CIV").

member.name: P:IpawsAlert.Core.Channels.EasChannelConfig.SameOverrideCodes
member.summary: FIPS SAME location codes for EAS targeting (6-digit strings). These are automatically pulled from CAP <area> SAME geocodes. Override here only if EAS targeting differs from the general area.

member.name: P:IpawsAlert.Core.Channels.EasChannelConfig.PurgeTime
member.summary: Purge time for the EAS header in format "HHNN" (hours + minutes). e.g. "0100" = 1 hour, "0030" = 30 minutes. If null, derived from the CAP expires field.

member.name: P:IpawsAlert.Core.Channels.EasChannelConfig.OriginatorCallsign
member.summary: Callsign of the originating station (up to 8 chars, e.g. "KNBC "). Padded to 8 characters with spaces in the EAS header.

member.name: T:IpawsAlert.Core.Channels.NwemChannelConfig
member.summary:
Configuration for the NWEM (National Warning System – Emergency Messages) channel.
NWEM distributes alerts through NOAA Weather Radio and the NWS. Appropriate for weather-originated emergencies.
